definitions.text: a space reserved for sitting (as in a theater or on a train or airplane)
examples: he booked their seats in advance
he sat in someone else's place

definitions.text: the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on
examples: he deserves a good kick in the butt
are you going to sit on your fanny and do nothing?

definitions.text: furniture that is designed for sitting on
examples: there were not enough seats for all the guests

definitions.text: any support where you can sit (especially the part of a chair or bench etc. on which you sit)
examples: he dusted off the seat before sitting down

definitions.text: a center of authority (as a city from which authority is exercised)
the location (metaphorically speaking) where something is based
examples: the brain is said to be the seat of reason

definitions.text: the legal right to sit as a member in a legislative or similar body
examples: he was elected to a seat in the Senate

definitions.text: a part of a machine that supports or guides another part
the cloth covering for the buttocks
examples: the seat of his pants was worn through

definitions.text: show to a seat; assign a seat for
examples: The host seated me next to Mrs. Smith

definitions.text: place ceremoniously or formally in an office or position
examples: there was a ceremony to induct the president of the Academy

definitions.text: put a seat on a chair
place or attach firmly in or on a base
examples: seat the camera on the tripod

definitions.text: place in or on a seat
examples: the mother seated the toddler on the high chair
